trans-unit.source: Provides an abstract base for classes that present content from another technology as part of an interoperation scenario.
In addition, this class provides static methods for working with these sources, as well as the basic visual-layer presentation architecture.
Provides initialization for base class values when called by the constructor of a derived class.
Adds a <xref href="System.Windows.PresentationSource"></xref> derived class instance to the list of known presentation sources.
This method should be called by derived classes to indicate that they need to be tracked.
Adds a handler for the <xref uid="langword_csharp_SourceChanged" name="SourceChanged" href=""></xref> event to the provided element.
Despite what the syntax block for this event states, there is no legitimate [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)] attached property usage.

You should not attempt to add handlers in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)], and handlers in code should only be placed on objects that serve as hosts for presentation (<xref:System.Windows.PresentationSource> ) content.
Such handlers should only be attached during object initialization, and should be explicitly removed in a Dispose method or equivalent object cleanup.

Even though this is a routed event, there are special restrictions placed on this event that differ from normal routed event behavior, due to the relatively small number of elements in a typical application scenario that would concern themselves with handling this event.
- You cannot use the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> or <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement> <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.AddHandler%2A> methods to add handlers.
You must use AddSourceChangedHandler.

- The [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_cshrp](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-cshrp-md.md)] `+=` and `-=` event handler syntaxes, and related language specific handler syntaxes, are not supported, because the event itself is not exposed as public.
Only the <xref:System.Windows.PresentationSource> utility methods for adding and removing the handlers directly are supported.
- Class handlers are not allowed.

Specifically, you cannot call <xref:System.Windows.EventManager.RegisterClassHandler%2A> against this event in a class constructor because although an identifier field exists for SourceChanged, the identifier is not public.
- All registered handlers will receive the SourceChanged event even if one of the handlers attempts to mark the arguments as handled.
The element to add the handler to.
The hander implementation to add.
Sets the list of listeners for the <xref href="System.Windows.PresentationSource.ContentRendered"></xref> event to <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Gets the visual target for the visuals being presented in the source.
The return of this property relies on an implementation of <xref:System.Windows.PresentationSource.GetCompositionTargetCore%2A>.
A visual target (instance of a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CompositionTarget"></xref> derived class).
Occurs when content is rendered and ready for user interaction.
To be added.
Returns a list of sources.
The returned list supports an enumerator over a read-only, thread-safe copy of the list of sources as added with <xref:System.Windows.PresentationSource.AddSource%2A>.
The enumerator skips any dead weak references in the list.
A list of weak references.
Returns the source in which a provided <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyObject"></xref> is presented.
The <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyObject"></xref> to find the source for.
The <xref href="System.Windows.PresentationSource"></xref> in which the dependency object is being presented.
Returns the source in which a provided <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> is presented.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> to find the source for.
The in which the visual is being presented, or if visual is disposed.
visual is .
When overridden in a derived class, returns a visual target for the given source.
Returns a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CompositionTarget"></xref> that is target for rendering the visual.
When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that declares whether the object is disposed.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the object is disposed; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Removes a <xref href="System.Windows.PresentationSource"></xref> derived class instance from the list of known presentation sources.
Removes a handler for the <xref uid="langword_csharp_SourceChanged" name="SourceChanged" href=""></xref> event from the provided element.

Even though this is a routed event, there are special restrictions placed on this event that differ from normal routed event behavior, due to the relatively small number of elements in a typical application scenario that would concern themselves with handling this event.
- You cannot use the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> or <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement> <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.RemoveHandler%2A> methods to remove handlers.
You must use RemoveSourceChangedHandler.

- The [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_cshrp](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-cshrp-md.md)] `+=` and `-=` event handler syntaxes, and other language specific handler syntaxes, are not supported, because the event itself is not exposed as public.
Only the <xref:System.Windows.PresentationSource> utility methods for adding and removing the handlers directly are supported.
The element to remove the handler from.
The handler implementation to remove.
Provides notification that the root <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> has changed.
Derived classes should call this method to indicate that their root <xref:System.Windows.Media.Visual> has changed.
Calling this method causes two object lifetime events to be raised on the specified root visuals, if and only if those root visuals are <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement> derived classes.
- The old root visual will raise the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Unloaded> event, and will process its tree of elements downward, broadcasting this event to each child element.
- The new root visual will raise the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Loaded> event, and will process its tree of elements downward, broadcasting this event to each child element.
The old root <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref>.
The new root <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref>.
When overridden in a derived class, gets or sets the root visual being presented in the source.
The root visual.
